instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. Liquid damage I repaired 1 month ago and now back here again. Problem was arroun lvds connector. I replaced it again but no video, no backlight. I miss <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW</SIGNAL>
I checked <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and no short there. I also miss <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>

Mouse is on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: LCD not recognized. Try a known good LCD assembly and check pins 4 6 and 7 of LCD connector. Also check that <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Sorry if I dont understand you, but screen to be recognized I should have at least one uncondition present power supplay to the screen. Isnot that LCDVDD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: pin 4 supplies 3V to the EEPROM in the LCD that has the EDID information for the system to "see" the LCD. So pins 4 6 7 should always have 3V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
You are always right. L9008 - 80 ohm
Will replace tomorrow and test. This is the problem I think.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
I replaced this coil and now backlight is ok and video too. Everything work now.

But when I removed the lvds connector before I damage pins <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_6</SIGNAL>
However backlight is ok. There are no conction betwen <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_6</SIGNAL> and <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>

It is easy to connect them as there are resistores but I am suprised it works. It make sense? <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN</SIGNAL> are not important??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Backlight will be uneven. Put some wirer from connector to the resistor in the return lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Backlight is off again. When I power the board screen blink in white and then became black again. 20 seg later blink again and sometumes backlight appear for 3-6 seg only. After 40seg I noted thet LP got hot. Any thing suspect? I already replaced <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Yes the return lines check all 6 of them for shorts to GND, shorts between then and continuity to the LCD connector.
